author: Staff Reporter
text:
As part of their annual activity, the military band at the Officers Training Academy took part in an Indo-Western music concert recently.

The event was attended by senior civil and military dignitaries and officers. The band had three sections, woodwind, brass and percussion. They played several compositions by celebrated musicians from around the world apart from their widely-appreciated patriotic songs, hymns and overtures.

The OTA Military Band was established in 1973 with musicians from various regiments of Indian Army. Since its launch, the band has been instrumental in boosting the morale of trainee cadets. The band has been participating in passing-out parades, band concerts, wreath-laying ceremonies and other parades at the State and national level.

The event was also attended by cadets from the academy.

Lieutenant General Bobby Mathews, Commandant of the Academy, was present.

On Sunday, around 250 retired officers from the Army, Air Force and Navy had an informal meeting at the Palm Grove officers institute at Island Grounds to discuss the problems faced by them, a press release said.

They played compositions by celebrated musicians from around the world
title: Military band stages Indo-Western music concert
